sentence.Network_en: Beauty is an attitude. It has nothing to do with age.
sentence.Network_cn: 美是一种态度，与年龄无关。

sentence.Network_en: English has hurt me a thousand times, but I still regard it as my first love.
sentence.Network_cn: 英语伤我千百遍，我待英语如初恋。

sentence.Network_en: Success is not guaranteed. It is not handed to you. Success is earned.
sentence.Network_cn: 成功无法保证，并非唾手可得。成功必须靠自己去争取。

jx.jx_en_mean: that is the main point or difficulty
jx.jx_cn_mean: 那正是要点；那正是问题所在

lj.lj_ly: ‘Is she going?’ ‘That's just it—she can't make up her mind.’.
lj.lj_ls: “她去吗？”“那正是问题所在——她拿不定主意。”。

jx.jx_en_mean: that is enough or the end

lj.lj_ly: okay, that's it, you've cried long enough.
lj.lj_ls: 好了，你已经哭得够久的了。

jx.jx_en_mean: the expected event is about to happen
jx.jx_cn_mean: （盼望的事情）即将发生；即将来临

jx.jx_en_mean: this is enough or the end
this is the main point or difficulty
jx.jx_cn_mean: 这正是要点；这正是问题所在

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English hit, neuter of he, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch het

encyclopedia.content: 原意在英语中指代物的第三人称单数。另有其他单词的缩写，例如信息技术：Information Technology；即时翻译 instant translation；创新技术innovative technology等。

entry.tran: 它(指物体、动物或上文已提及的其他事物)
entry.def: You use it to refer to an object, animal, or other thing that has already been mentioned.

example.ex: He saw the grey Land-Rover down the bypass. It was more than a hundred yards from him...
example.tran: 他看见那辆灰色的路虎越野车停在不远处的边道上,离他一百码开外。

example.ex: It's a wonderful city, really. I'll show it to you if you want...
example.tran: 这真是一座很棒的城市,如果你愿意的话我领你看看。

entry.def: You use it to refer to a child or baby whose sex you do not know or whose sex is not relevant to what you are saying.

example.ex: She could, if she wanted, compel him, through a court of law, to support the child after it was born...
example.tran: 如果她愿意,她可以通过法庭强制他在孩子出生以后抚养孩子。

example.ex: He threw the baby high in the air and it stopped crying.
example.tran: 他把孩子向空中高高抛起,孩子就停止了哭闹。

entry.def: You use it to refer in a general way to a situation that you have just described.

example.ex: He was through with sports, not because he had to be but because he wanted it that way...
example.tran: 他放弃了体育运动,不是因为被迫而是出于自愿。

example.ex: Antonia will not be jealous, or if she is, she will not show it.
example.tran: 安东尼娅不会嫉妒,即便嫉妒,她也不会表现出来。

entry.tran: (用于某些名词、形容词、动词前说明对某情况的感受、观点)
entry.def: You use it before certain nouns, adjectives, and verbs to introduce your feelings or point of view about a situation.

example.ex: It was nice to see Steve again...
example.tran: 再次见到史蒂夫真是太好了。

example.ex: It's a pity you never got married, Sarah...
example.tran: 萨拉,你没结过婚真是遗憾啊。

entry.tran: (用于被动句中引出一个情况或事件)
entry.def: You use it in passive clauses which report a situation or event.

example.ex: It has been said that stress causes cancer...
example.tran: 据说压力会引发癌症。

example.ex: Yesterday it was reported that a number of people had been arrested in the capital...
example.tran: 昨天据报道有很多人在首都被捕。

entry.tran: (与动词连用,作形式主语或宾语)
entry.def: You use it with some verbs that need a subject or object, although there is no noun that it refers to.

example.ex: Of course, as it turned out, three-fourths of the people in the group were psychiatrists...
example.tran: 当然,结果是那群人中 3/4 是精神病学家。

example.ex: I like it here...
example.tran: 我喜欢这里。

entry.tran: (用作 be动词的主语,指钟点、星期、日期)
entry.def: You use it as the subject of 'be', to say what the time, day, or date is.

example.ex: It's three o'clock in the morning...
example.tran: 现在是凌晨 3 点整。

example.ex: It was a Monday, so she was at home...
example.tran: 那天是星期一,因此她在家里。

entry.tran: (用作系动词的主语，描述天气、光线或温度)
entry.def: You use it as the subject of a link verb to describe the weather, the light, or the temperature.

example.ex: It was very wet and windy the day I drove over the hill to Milland...
example.tran: 那天风雨交加,我开车翻过小山去米兰德。

example.ex: It's getting dark. Let's go inside...
example.tran: 天色暗下来了,我们进去吧。

entry.tran: (尤用于刚接通电话时询问、告知身份)
entry.def: You use it when you are telling someone who you are, or asking them who they are, especially at the beginning of a phone call. You also use it in statements and questions about the identity of other people.

example.ex: 'Who is it?' he called. — 'It's your neighbor.'...
example.tran: “是谁啊?”他问道。——“是你的邻居。”

example.ex: Hello Freddy, it's only me, Maxine.
example.tran: 你好,弗蕾迪！是我,玛克辛。

entry.tran: (与动词 be 连用，强调突出某物)
entry.def: When you are emphasizing or drawing attention to something, you can put that thing immediately after it and a form of the verb 'be'.

example.ex: It's really the poor countries that don't have an economic base that have the worst environmental records...
example.tran: 确实是那些没有经济基础的穷国的环境记录最差。

example.ex: It was the country's rulers who devised this system...
example.tran: 是该国的执政者创造了这一体制。

entry.tran: 并不是因为/不仅仅因为
entry.def: You use it in expressions such as it's not that or it's not simply that when you are giving a reason for something and are suggesting that there are several other reasons.

example.ex: It's not that I didn't want to be with my family...
example.tran: 并不是我不想和家人在一起。

example.ex: It's not just that a gulf exists in living standards — there's a psychological ravine.
example.tran: 不仅仅是生活水平上存在巨大差异，心理上也有鸿沟。

entry.def: If you say that someone thinks they're it, you mean that they think they are better or more important than they really are.

example.en: How are they hitting it off these days?
example.zh: 他们现在相处得怎么样？

example.en: They hit it off from the start.
example.zh: 他们从一开始就很合得来。

example.en: He hit it off with the whole class.
example.zh: 他深受全班欢迎。

list.explanation: 上街示威，把本来属于私下的矛盾问题张扬出去

example.en: The debate was quiet for a time, then they took it to the street.
example.zh: 那场争论有一段时间外界并不知逍,他们到后来才闹出来让人知道的。

example.en: Come on, don't take it to the street!
example.zh: 千万千万，不要张扬出去!

list.explanation: (用鼻孔)吸粉末状毒品(常指吸可卡因)

example.en: One of those guys shoots it；the others smell it up.
example.zh: 那些人当中有一个人注射毒品，另外一些人则嗅吸毒品。

example.en: You must be smelling the stuff.
example.zh: 你准是在吸那东西(指毒品)。

list.explanation: (表示对某事物不欢迎、反感和蔑视)住手，真他妈的，去你的

example.en: You pig! Ram it! Take your hands off me!
example.zh: 你这臭猪!去你的，把你的手挪开，别碰我!

example.en: He told them to take the money and ram it.
example.zh: 他叫他们拿了那笔钱滚。

example.en: It's bad, all right. Don't I know it!
example.zh: 不好，真的。千真万确!

list.explanation: (表示失望、愤怒、失意等的感叹讯)

example.en: Doggone it, leave me be!
example.zh: 唉，別管我了!

example.en: Hatfmld had it in for McCoy.
example.zh: 哈特菲尔德对麦科伊十分不满。

list.explanation: (表示同意对方的话)是这样!就是这个!说得对!

example.en: This is it! The world's best pizza!
example.zh: 就是这个!天下最好的比萨饼!

list.explanation: (表示面临严酷、危急或关键时刻)大事不好了!不可避免的事情终于发生了!准备对付最坏的局面!

example.en: Okay, this is it, the last chance!
example.zh: 好，这是关键时刻，最后的机会!

example.en: Get ready, this is it! Jump now!
example.zh: 准备好，大难临头了!现在跳!

list.explanation: (表示轻蔑，不信等)见鬼去吧，去你的(即闭嘴别说了)

example.en: I started to explain, but the cop told me to flush it.
example.zh: 我刚开始解释,可是警察叫我闭嘴别说了。

list.explanation: 克制愤怒与激动，保持平静

example.en: Take it easy, Mac, nobody's hurt.
example.zh: 麦克，别发火，没人受伤。

example.en: They told me to take it easy for a few days.
example.zh: 他们叫我休息几天。

example.en: Take it easy; we've got plenty of time.
example.zh: 别着急，我们时间很充裕。

example.en: See you later. Take it easy!
example.zh: 再见啦,保重!

list.explanation: 不能取胜的或成功的，淘汰的

example.en: The Hawks are out of it this season.
example.zh: 近来鹰派人失势了。

example.en: If our team loses two more games, we'll be out of it.
example.zh: 要是我们队再输两场，那我们就会被淘汰。

example.en: He's a nice guy, but he's out of it.
example.zh: 他人是个好人，可惜不合潮流。

example.en: Fred is out of it most of the time. He even looks dull.
example.zh: 弗雷德常常不合潮流，他甚至看上去都木讷迟钝。

list.explanation: (吸毒迷醉而)神志恍惚的，酒醉的

example.en: I had been so out of it, I hadn't heard her question.
example.zh: 那时候我神忐恍惚，根本没有听见她的问话。

example.en: Drop it! I should never have brought it up.
example.zh: 別闹了!我不应该把那事提出来的。

example.en: Let's drop it. shall we?
example.zh: 我们不谈这个，好吗?

example.en: I think the boy has been concerned in criminal activity. so I've asked him to drop it.
example.zh: 我认为这孩子参与了犯罪活动，所以我叫他别干了。

example.en: It's rough as hell,but I'll stick it out.
example.zh: 日子难过得要命，不过我会坚持下去的。

example.en: The hundred stricken stuck it out to the end.
example.zh: 有上百名罢工者坚持罢工到底。

list.explanation: [表示极不愉快的感叹语] 糟了!该死!见鬼!

example.en: Oh. the devil take it! I've locked the key in the room.
example.zh: 啊，见鬼!我把钥匙锁在房里了!

list.explanation: 自找麻烦，自讨苦吃，惹人恼火

example.en: I don't know how they live down there. It's asking for it.
example.zh: 我不知道他们在那边怎么过日子。那是自讨苦吃。

example.en: He's raking it in already.
example.zh: 他已赚进许多钱。

auth_sentence.content: Colin Oates also made it through to his quarter-finals.
auth_sentence.res_content: Colin Oates also made it through to his quarter-finals.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Colin Oates also made it through to his quarter-finals.

auth_sentence.content: I think it is not about who was selected.
auth_sentence.res_content: I think it is not about who was selected.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I think it is not about who was selected.

auth_sentence.content: It doesn't really change what I'm doing.
auth_sentence.res_content: It doesn't really change what I'm doing.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It doesn't really change what I'm doing.

abbreviation.mean_cn: 存货，盘存，存货清单，盘存报表，财产目录

Sentence.sentence: Being equipped with one of the most recent cutting-edge IT products could just help a college or university foster a cutting-edge reputation.
In the author's view, being equipped with IT products may help colleges and universities build an innovative image

Huge obstacles It could, of course, also be that Obama's success helps people to forget that a disproportionate number of black Americans still live in poverty and face huge obstacles when trying to overcome these circumstances

sentences.en: This suitcase looks heavy but actually it is very light.
sentences.cn: 这个皮箱看上去很重, 实际上很轻。

sentences.en: Her baby's due next month.She hopes it will be a boy.
sentences.cn: 她怀的孩子下个月出生, 她希望是个男孩儿。

sentences.en: It is a very long way from the West Coast to the East of America.
sentences.cn: 从美国的西岸到东岸的距离是很长的。

sentences.en: It is ten o'clock in the morning.
It was on Sunday that an American friend of mine came to see me.
sentences.cn: 那个星期天, 我的一个美国朋友来看我。

sentences.en: Where did she go?—It was to Britain that she went.
sentences.cn: 她去了什么地方?——她去的地方是英国。

sentences.en: I don't like it that he should be alone with my girlfriend.
sentences.cn: 我可不喜欢他单独和我的女朋友在一起。

sentences.en: It is not easy if you ask her to stop.
sentences.cn: 你让她停下来可不容易。

sentences.en: It's very clear what the red-haired man means.
sentences.cn: 这个红头发男人的意思很明显。

jushi.english: It's very clear what the red-haired man means.
jushi.chinese: 这个红头发的男人的意思很明显。

jushi.english: This suitcase looks heavy but actually it is very light.
jushi.chinese: 这个皮箱看上去很重,实际上很轻。
